original_solution_mapping.L1: Dave weighs 175 pounds and can bench press three times his body weight, so he can bench press 175*3 = <<175*3=525>>525 pounds
original_solution_mapping.L2: Craig can only bench press 20% of Dave's 525 pounds, so Craig can bench press .20*525 = <<20*.01*525=105>>105 pounds
original_solution_mapping.L3: Craig bench presses 105 pounds and Mark does 50 pounds less than Craig, so Mark can only press 105-50 = <<105-50=55>>55 pounds

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2967.
    Returns: how much Mark can bench press.
    """
    # L1
    dave_weight = 175 # Dave weighs 175 pounds
    dave_multiplier = 3 # three times his body weight
    dave_bench_press = dave_weight * dave_multiplier

    # L2
    craig_percent_decimal = 0.20 # 20% of the amount Dave can
    craig_percent_num = 20 # 20% of the amount Dave can
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    craig_bench_press = craig_percent_decimal * dave_bench_press

    # L3
    mark_less_amount = 50 # 50 pounds less than Craig
    mark_bench_press = craig_bench_press - mark_less_amount

    # FA
    answer = mark_bench_press
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Dave weighs {dave_weight} pounds and can bench press {dave_multiplier} times his body weight, so he can bench press {dave_weight}*{dave_multiplier} = <<{dave_weight}*{dave_multiplier}={dave_bench_press}>>{dave_bench_press} pounds

Craig can only bench press {craig_percent_num}% of Dave's {dave_bench_press} pounds, so Craig can bench press {craig_percent_decimal}*{dave_bench_press} = <<{craig_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{dave_bench_press}={craig_bench_press}>>{craig_bench_press} pounds

Craig bench presses {craig_bench_press} pounds and Mark does {mark_less_amount} pounds less than Craig, so Mark can only press {craig_bench_press}-{mark_less_amount} = <<{craig_bench_press}-{mark_less_amount}={mark_bench_press}>>{mark_bench_press} pounds

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Dave weighs 175 pounds and can bench press 3 times his body weight, so he can bench press 175*3 = <<175*3=525>>525 pounds
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Craig can only bench press 20% of Dave's 525 pounds, so Craig can bench press 0.2*525 = <<20*0.01*525=105>>105 pounds
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Craig bench presses 525 pounds and Mark does 50 pounds less than Craig, so Mark can only press 525-50 = <<525-50=475>>475 pounds

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'dave_bench_press' (value: 525) was used instead of 'craig_bench_press' (value: 105.0).
